summary.p: 40 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 27; Qurʾānic Text: Q 69:44-73:16; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 255 x 182mm; Script style: kūfī D.III.
The fragment Marcel 28 (NLR) belongs to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 27
40 fol. 182×255 mm (1.4). Support: thin transparent parchment of yellowish color with traces of polishing. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation:
I: H1F H2F S H3F H4F H5F / F6H F7H F8H F9H S F10H;
II: H11F H12F S H13F H14F S H15F / F16H S F17H F18H F19H S F20H;
III: H21F H22F S H23F H24F S H25F / F26H S F27H F28H F29H S F30H;
IV: H31F H32F S H33F H34F S H35F / F36H S F37H F38H F39H S F40H
Text layout: 78/82×156/164 mm (2.0), 5 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D III. Diacritics: diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text. Vocalization: red, blue and green dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – rosettes (close to type 3.1.2) in gold, green and red; for groups of five verses – medallions on the margins in gold, red and green (close to type 4.A.II) with the inscribed word خمس; for groups of ten verses – medallions on the margins (close to type 3.D.II) in gold, red and blue with the inscribed numbers of verses (خمسون – fol. 2r, عشر – fol. 4v, 17r, 28v, 39r, عشرون – fol. 6r, 20r, 32v, ثلثون – fol. 8v, اربعون – fol. 11r).

Surah titles are written in gold and accompanied with large palmettos on the margins in gold, red and green paint, outlined with blue: surah 70 – سأل سائل اربعون واربع (fol. 2v); surah 71 – نوح ثلثون اية (fol.13r); surah 72 – الجن عشرون وثمان (fol. 24r); surah 73 – المزمّل عشرون ايه(fol. 36v).
Inscriptions: all the sheets have marks in pencil (in the 3d and 4th quire – in black ink) on the upper margins with the surah numbers in Roman numerals and verse numbers in Arabic numerals.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold; on the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (leather?).
Defects: stains on some pages; outer margins damaged, probably by rodents; parchment destruction caused by aggressive ink on fol. 9, 13, 18, 23; ink has peeled off on the flesh sides of some sheets.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with letters “E”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink – “du 44 v. de la Sourate LXIX, jusque au v. 6 de la LXXIII. / les LXX, LXXI et LXXII completes” and old accession number in red pencil “В. 5”; on the verso side the name “Monsieur Merlin” inscribed in brown ink.
Old accession numbers: Е (on the wrapping), B. 5 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–2v. Surah 69, verses 44(44) – 52(52)*. Incipit: [ولو] تقول علينا.
Fol. 2v–13r. Surah 70.
Fol. 13r–24r. Surah 71.
Fol. 24r–36v. Surah 72.
Fol. 36v–40v. Surah 73, verses 1(1) – 16(16). Explicit: رسولاً * فعصى [فرعونُ] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Marcel 28 (NLR)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
An image of fol. 36v can be seen on the website of the NLR (No. 10).
